active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a red team engagement, how does mapping an org chart influence phishing success rates? Debate the trade-offs between depth of intel and time spent, using real-world breach examples like SolarWinds.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Penetration Testing and Ethical Hacking. Topic: Organizational Chart Mapping (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Penetration Testing And Ethical Hacking > Penetration Testing Methodology > 002_Intelligence Gathering and Reconnaissance > Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) > Organizational Chart Mapping). Incorporate these pedagogical elements: - Learning Objectives: [insert full list above] - Active Learning: [insert summaries of discussion, peer teaching, problem-solving] - Scaffolding Layers: [insert full layer details] Generate 20-30 high-quality flashcards following this exact schema: [insert full flashcard_schema above] Ensure coverage: 25% Layer 1/REMEMBER-UNDERSTAND, 25% Layer 2/APPLY, 25% Layer 3/ANALYZE, 25% Layer 4/EVALUATE-CREATE. Draw from PTES, MITRE ATT&CK, tools (LinkedIn, theHarvester, Maltego, SEC), examples (SolarWinds). Use university pedagogy: active recall, spaced repetition friendly, no spoilers on fronts. Output ONLY as JSON array: [{'front': '...', 'options': ['A: ...', ...], 'back': {'correct_answer': 'A', 'explanation': '...', 'distractors_explained': {...}, 'reference': '...'}}, ...] Voter priorities integrated: Step-by-step OSINT, real-world cases, measurable objectives.
